]]> Comment on zcamo chasing by Mike ellis http://www.mgimageryphotography.com/the-lonely-road/zcamo-chasing/#comment-19579 Mon, 03 Oct 2016 19:27:13 +0000 http://www.mgimageryphotography.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/zcamo-chasing.jpg#comment-19579 Love this photo! Any more of this model?

]]> Comment on Lonely #14 C, the Sincline Video by mike http://www.mgimageryphotography.com/lonely-14-c-the-sincline-video/#comment-18907 Wed, 22 Jun 2016 18:22:15 +0000 http://www.mgimageryphotography.com/?p=327#comment-18907 Oh, man…..sometimes I freeze up on this stuff too. What I’ve found is best for me is to “think” about an entry for a week or two, jot down ideas, and then come back to it several times before I sit down and write. I find that “revisiting” an idea a few times before committing myself to writing allows more ideas and variations to pop into my mind which in turn helps me to better tell my story. So, i’ll review tons of photos, think about the scenario, keep re-looking at the photos and considering others….and over a couple of weeks my story typically comes together! Like, the Pathfinder entry I’m starting today.
